{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient's presentation of periorbital edema and lower extremity edema, along with effacement of podocytes on kidney biopsy, is consistent with nephrotic syndrome. In nephrotic syndrome, there is increased permeability of the glomerular filtration barrier, leading to proteinuria. The most common finding on urinalysis in nephrotic syndrome is the presence of fatty casts and albumin, indicating lipiduria and proteinuria. Therefore, the answer is B. Fatty casts and albumin.", "answer_choice": "B"}
